labels.analysis: The MCP Server operates as a Public Holidays Service, providing users with up-to-date public holiday information for various countries and regions. The primary tool available allows users to check holiday information for a given country and date. This functionality enhances scheduling and planning by dynamically retrieving holiday data, which is particularly useful for applications that need to account for public holidays in their workflows or user calendars.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Database Operations" was chosen because the server essentially acts as a database for holiday information, allowing users to query specific data based on country and date. The secondary label "Time & Calendar" was selected because the service is closely related to time-based scheduling and planning. No custom label is needed as the functionality fits well into the predefined categories.

tools.name: check_holiday
tools.description: Get holiday information for a given country and date.

server_info_crawled.name: Public Holidays Service
server_info_crawled.author: @ismailcan0/publicholidaysmcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide up-to-date public holiday information for various countries and regions. Enable applications to query and retrieve holiday data dynamically to enhance scheduling and planning features. Simplify integration of holiday awareness into your workflows and agents.

tools.name: check_holiday
tools.description: Get holiday information for a given country and date.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@ismailcan0/publicholidaysmcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
